Covid App AstraZeneca Vaccine
//AstraZeneca Questions AstraZeneca COVID-19 Vaccine has side effects. Headache is a known side effect of AstraZeneca vaccine. Bleeding is a known side effect of AstraZeneca vaccine. Only one dose of AstraZeneca is required. People under 60 are eligible to take the AstraZeneca vaccine. //Pfizer Questions Breathing difficulty is a known side effects of Pfizer vaccine. If I experience any of the side effects, I shouldn\’t call for help. Can Pfizer vaccine make me develop Covid-19? Children under 12 are eligible to take Pfizer vaccine. Muscle pains is another side effect of Pfizer vaccine. //Sinopharm Questions Sinopharm is recommended for people under 18. Headache is NOT a side effect of Sinopharm vaccine. Fever is NOT a side effect of Sinopharm vaccine. Sinopharm vaccine could cause pain at the injection site. Fatigue is NOT a side effect of Sinopharm vaccine.
TRUE FALSE NEXT Fill Form Correct! Incorrect!
The Oxford–AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine, is a viral vector vaccine for prevention of COVID-19. Developed by Oxford University and AstraZeneca, it is given by intramuscular injection, Studies carried out in 2020 showed that the efficacy of the vaccine is 76.0% at preventing symptomatic COVID-19 beginning at 22 days following the first dose and 81.3% after the second dose. More Info Pfizer Vaccine
The Pfizer–BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine, sold under the brand name Comirnaty, is an mRNA-based COVID-19 vaccine developed by the German company BioNTech. It is authorized for use in people aged 12 years and older in some jurisdictions and for people 16 years and older in other jurisdictions
Sinopharm Vaccine As an inactivated vaccine like CoronaVac and Covaxin, BBIBP-CorV uses a more traditional technology that is similar to the inactivated polio vaccine. Initially, a sample of SARS-CoV-2 from China capable of rapid multiplication was used to grow large quantities of the virus using vero cells.
